Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES THE STUDENT WITH THE ACCOUNTING INFORMATION AND TRAINING NECESSARY TO COLLECT, PREPARE AND ANALYZE THE OBJECTIVE DATA AND SUBJECTIVE ESTIMATES USED BY MANAGEMENT TO CONDUCT DAILY OPERATIONS, PLAN FUTURE OPERATIONS AND DEVELOP OVERALL BUSINESS STRATEGIES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
ON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO:
1. PREPARE, ANALYZE AND USE MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING REPORTS TO UNDERSTAND THE DYNAMICS OF BUSINESS OPERATIONS,
2. IDENTIFY AND CORRECT PROBLEM AREAS,
3. IDENTIFY AND EXPLOIT OPPORTUNITY AREAS AND
4. MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO SUPPORT THE ORGANIZATIONS STRATEGIC AND TACTICAL PLANNING. 

LEARNING OBJECTIVES
- COMPARE AND CONTRAST MANAGERIAL AND FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING.
- UNDERSTAND AND APPLY THE BASICS OF COST ACCOUNTING SYSTEMS.
- DISTINGUISH BETWEEN FIXED AND VARIABLE COSTS.
- EXPLAIN AND INTERPRET THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN COST OBJECTS, COST DRIVERS AND COST ALLOCATION.
- DESCRIBE AND APPLY SENSITIVITY AND CVP (COST-VOLUME-PROFIT) FORMULAS AND ANALYSIS.
- UNDERSTAND THE CONCEPT OF SUNK COSTS AND DISTINGUISH BETWEEN RELEVANT AND IRRELEVANT COSTS.
- UNDERSTAND AND APPLY THE BUDGETING PROCESS FOR FIXED AND VARIABLE BUDGETS.
- DESCRIBE AND USE VARIANCE AND RATIO ANALYSIS AS AN AID TO MANAGEMENT DECISIONS.
- DESCRIBE AND APPLY THE BASIC CONCEPTS OF CAPITAL INVESTMENT ANALYSIS.
- PREPARE AND ANALYZE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (PROFIT AND LOSS, BALANCE SHEETS, FUNDS FLOW STATEMENTS).
Textbook(s): FUNDAMENTAL MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS BY T.P. EDMONDS, BOR-YI TSAY, AND P.R. OLDS - MCGRAW-HILL.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
